channel.title: Proprietary tyrant competitors and project values
channel.description:
[quote="nurmagoz, post:1, topic:1156"] # Competitors
[...]
If we don’t stay ahead of these developments, control over security will slip from our hands, placing it instead in the hands of large corporations or state-backed entities. [/quote]
I am not worried about this.
Related wiki chapter: [Freedom vs Tyrant Security](https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Miscellaneous_Threats_to_User_Freedom#Freedom_vs_Tyrant_Security)
Hypothetical user quote:
> Due to lack of `<insert cool security feature>` by proprietary tyrant, I switched from Debian/Kicksecure to Google Android/iOS.
That user doesn't exist or is a minority infeasible to chase.
In any case, we obviously cannot directly compete with proprietary tyrant companies with billions of USD in funding. That's mission impossible.
We can only compete on values.
Such values include (non-exhausive list):
* https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Policy_On_Nonfreedom_Software * https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Reasons_for_Freedom_Software * freedom security * absence of anti-features (tracking, spyware) * user freedom * https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Transparency
Users that don't prioritize these values, won't be interested in Kicksecure.
Other potential higher priority values many users will prefer (non-exhausive list):
* usability * compatibility * fashion / status symbol * performance / speed

item.title: Proprietary tyrant competitors and project values
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
MicroKernel Archetecture is the Future

Competitors

[…]

If we don’t stay ahead of these developments, control over security will slip from our hands, placing it instead in the hands of large corporations or state-backed entities.

I am not worried about this.

Related wiki chapter:
Freedom vs Tyrant Security

Hypothetical user quote:

Due to lack of <insert cool security feature> by proprietary tyrant, I switched from Debian/Kicksecure to Google Android/iOS.

That user doesn’t exist or is a minority infeasible to chase.

In any case, we obviously cannot directly compete with proprietary tyrant companies with billions of USD in funding. That’s mission impossible.

We can only compete on values.

Such values include (non-exhausive list):

  • Kicksecure ™ Policy On Non-Freedom Software
  • Reasons for Freedom Software / Open Source
  • freedom security
  • absence of anti-features (tracking, spyware)
  • user freedom
  • Kicksecure Project Transparency

Users that don’t prioritize these values, won’t be interested in Kicksecure.

Other potential higher priority values many users will prefer (non-exhausive list):

  • usability
  • compatibility
  • fashion / status symbol
  • performance / speed

Read full topic
item.source: Proprietary tyrant competitors and project values
